page.title: 03ADDIEWELL COMBINED SCHOOLS
page.content: Our school, St.Thomas R.C.Addiewell is unique.It is the only school in Scotland to share a building with the village's non denominational school to the extent that does. The school opened in 1978 and was built to replace two separate schools. It is an open_plan building with four main teaching blocks,two of which are used by St.Thomas and two by Addiewell Primary. Although there are two headteachers there is only one secretary and one janitor.The pupils and staffs work very closely together.They share a dining room and a staffroom as well as large items of equipment such as a photocopier and a video.Pupils go on outings together,on residential visits as well as combining for football and other team sports.
